data.title: The Filet - I'll order it again
data.text:
I have eaten at many of the downtown restaurants in Decatur, and the filet steak is as good as any of them. It was cooked right, a great rub or spice on it, and the sauce was good. The potatoes matched up well.
The menu is actually pretty broad with food for most tastes. All 5 of us had different items and there were no complaints at all. The place has plenty of room with tables spread out, so no crowding or inability to talk. Lots of free 2- and 3-hour parking nearby.

data.title: New menu
data.text: We were frequent lunch patrons as well as evening occasionally.  We loved the items provided by the previous owner and chefs well prepared wraps, salads and beef selectons along with interesting sandwiches.  These no longer are offered and we do not care for the limited offerings.  Wait staff is excellent! Dinner is average.

data.title: Decent restaurant
data.text: Nice friendly service. Decent food. Good environment.   I had tuna which was very good, however I have not enjoyed the side very much. My friend had scallops , which he liked.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Food was excellent,  I had osso buco and my wife had medallions.  We both thought  our  dinners were good and we had enough for dinner the next night.  I thought the quality might be better than their competition..

data.title: Not bad
data.text: The Resturant is one large open room in a quaint old building, it was very noisy, but the staff and service were excellent. The food was fairly good. Very meat and seafood heavy. Being a vegetarian I appreciated the vegan options. I had a spanakopita  that was fair and oddly served on a bed of tomato sauce with wild rice.

data.title: One of the best in Decatur
data.text: Great - truly chef prepared and it shows. Much better with the new owner. Dishes are ample for the price. One negative was that the staff seemed preoccupied to take time at our table. They just sort of sweeped by in their attempt to serve us. Hopefully that was just being NEW to the business.

data.title: A great birthday celebration
data.text: We have been going to the Bizou for years but the experience we had last Saturday was by far the best. I had invited another couple from out of town to join us. We brought in a couple of bottles of special wine we got for the occasion.  One was a bubbly so Dana brought frosted flutes. She asked if we were ready for menus or would we like some time to visit. She let us just relax and when we were ready she came back and answered our questions. She then decanted our second bottle.  The food was wonderful. The filet. The halibut. The ribeye. The stuffed chicken. Mashed potatoes. Green beans ALL was perfect. Dana then came out with creme brûlée with a candle. We sat and talked quite awhile afterwards and never felt rushed. It was a perfect night for my husbands birthday and was proud to bring our friends to Decatur.

data.title: Too noisy to return
data.text:
Wanted this to be great but it was only average.  Warm welcome but had to ask for menus. Menu had interesting possibilities, lots of variety.  Service was mixed, nothing special.  Three of same house salad but each was different.  One was drowning in the vinaigrette dressing maling that salad inedible. However no one came by so we could ask for a redo. Steaks were nicely done and good quality.  Men were unhappy that no rolls or bread was offered.  Portions were large.  Sides were generally good.
        But the reason we will probably not return was the overall noise level.  It was impossible to talk with person next to you, let alone have any table conversation at a table for four. Very stressful even trying to visit.  While not crowded, except for one very large group, it is such a hard room and was so loud that we couldn't wait to leave.  Went elsewhere for dessert and coffee.

data.title: Absolutely the place to go...
data.text: Traveling through Decatur for a family event - driving down main street looking for a quick bite, we walked into Bizou - absolutely fabulous food and wonderful service. The best clams with buttery, wine sauce, fantastic pot stickers and kimchi - who would have thought - every dish delicious - highly recommended.

data.title: Romantic and delicious
data.text: Went here for a date night, made reservations not really sure they were necessary since it wasn't that busy but will always do just in case. The food was delicious, steak was cooked perfectly!! Loved the atmosphere and the service was great. Ordered a drink and it wasn't all that great, didn't say anything but the waitress brought me a different one because the bartender didn't like how she made the first one! Will be back for sure!

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text: My first visit to Bizou, and it was excellent.  I love the open kitchen at Bizou, because restaurants with open kitchens tend to be confident (perhaps cocky) about their chefs and food.  And that confidence is in full bloom at Bizou.  The chefs efficiently and quietly prepare meals within view of diners in perfect kitchen choreography.  The best part of the dining experience is when the meal is brought to your table by a friendly server - it's is pure heaven.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text:
After a long morning dealing with my father's estate we stopped here for lunch.  The food was great!  Better half had the eggs Benedict special and I had the figgylicious grilled cheese.  The grilled cheese was great!  It was served on farmer's bread with fig preserves, and a melange of cheeses.  It was so good!  
We live in a big city out west and this food was equal to any of our good restaurants.  If we get time, we will go back again.

data.title: Just Wow!
data.text: Every time I have eaten here the food has been fantastic! It is a little pricy by Decatur standards...but not out of line with other restaurants of this calibre. We usually save this one for special occasions, or when we just want a nice quiet meal. The last time I ate here was Valentine's Day and we got the special...Have you ever had one of those meals where you keep thinking about it later? Well, this was one of those...Prawns for appetizers that I had to cut with a fork and knife about 4 times each as they were huge! Filet and scallops for the entree... I need to stop now cause I am getting hungry just thinking about it...let's just say we topped it off with creme brûlée and skipped the movie we planned on going too because we were too stuffed to even think about sitting through a movie...

data.title: Quiet atmosphere with great food and service.
data.text: This restaurant offers a quiet relaxing atmosphere and an eclectic decor. The menu is varied from med range to expensive for the area. Your table provides a view of the chefs at work as well as the high pressed tin ceiling and the old original cast iron columns of this vintage building. Large canvases by local artists grace the walls and interesting halogen track lighting provide subdued but comfortable lighting. I thought the osso buco was wonderful. My wife loved the panko crusted Chilean sea bass. On a previous visit my daughter had the rare tuna with wasabi sauce. Too hot and rare for me but she thought it was great.

data.title: My Favorite
data.text: Great affordable, gourmet bistro that uses local, fresh ingredients. My favorite Decatur IL place to eat!

data.title: Tapas Tuesadys !!
data.text: We have gone twice on Tuesdays where they have a small plate menu and ordered 4  to 6 small plates both times.   They were all wondrful.  It was a great way to sample a variety of tasty food.

data.title: All Superlatives Without Question - Always!
data.text: Impeccable food, drinks, service, ambience - never fails with each visit always perfect.  Being alone or with a large group, Bizou is the place to go. Bizou = Magnificent! A real asset for Decatur.

data.title: Better restaurants in Decatur
data.text:
We dine here annually with college friends. Service for our group of 17 was slow because of slow kitchen prep.  Our salads were delivered promptly and were fresh and delicious. My wife ordered grilled Halibut with grilled asparagus. The fish was dry and the asparagus was over grilled. I ordered the vegan stir fry and it too was over grilled. 
The menu offerings include no entrée salads.  
We will likely eat here again next year only as a courtesy to our planning host. 
We would not dine here of our own free will and accord.

data.title: Bad service, Bad food
data.text: I have been to Bizou about 4 times.  new years eve and my birthday being 2 of the times and the food was bad and the waitress seemed very unhappy to be there.  she didnt speak to us.  Just looked at us.  And the salmon was very dry and the scallops had a bitter taste.  My husband and I both felt sick later.  I do not recommend it.  The dessert menu is terrible too.  They dont even have a good chocolate dish.

data.title: Average at best
data.text: Family has eaten at Bizou only a few times, and I doubt we will go back. got the Chilean Sea Bass, and it wasn't cooked properly.. yuck... ordered Grilled Swordfish steak and it was super bland and overcooked.  I will say, my date had the Delmonico steak and it tasted fantastic.  The service is mediocre at best.  Tries to be foo foo and fails if you get my drift.  Semi-romantic setting, but at these prices, you at least expect the food to be prepared properly.  If you absolutely must go, order the Lobster Bisque soup.  Touch to mess that up.
